text: Clemens Mayer (middle) at the German Memory Championships Clemens Mayer (born September 25, 1985 in Brannenburg) is a German memory sports person. He was World Memory Champion in 2005 and 2006.World Memory Championship siteTimes Online At the age of 19 years and 10 months, he became the youngest-ever world memory champion in 2005. 12 years later, in 2017, then-18-year- and 11-month- old Mongolian Munkhshur Narmandakh became the youngest champion ever and Mayer lost this record. He uses the method of loci. He originally intended to be an Olympic runner, but decided to go into memory sports after watching Gunther Karsten on German television.Discover Magazine Since participating in the South German Memory Championship on 24 June 2007, he did not compete in any championship of memory sports.CLEMENS MAYER iam-stats.com == References == Category:1985 births Category:Living people Category:Mnemonists
